summary: The 'Strengthening Prosecution Integrity for Espionage Statutes Act' (SPIES Act) eliminates the statute of limitations for certain espionage offenses, specifically violations of sections 951, 794, and 1425 of Title 18 of the United States Code. It also makes a minor conforming amendment to the Internal Security Act of 1950. The bill aims to strengthen national security by allowing for the prosecution of espionage-related crimes regardless of how much time has passed since the offense.
